title: AngoraSix Methodology
subtitle: A clear process that adapts to your project's stage and characteristics. Explore the stages and activate what applies from the right panel.

presets.title: Quick Presets
presets.tooltip: Pre-configured scenarios that automatically set the most relevant aspects for common project types. You can adjust individual settings after selecting a preset.

startup.label: Early Startup
startup.tooltip: New product, small team, core ownership, closed development, no revenue yet. Focus on validation and basic structure.

venture.label: Mature Venture
venture.tooltip: Validated product, experienced management, core team structure, stable revenue. Focus on optimization and growth.

community.label: Open Community
community.tooltip: New collaborative project, decentralized governance, open to contributors, community-driven development.

subproject.label: Sub-project
subproject.tooltip: Part of larger organization, validated approach, centralized admin, stable funding and processes.

traditional.label: Traditional Manager
traditional.tooltip: Established product, mature management, centralized control, stable revenue, traditional corporate structure.

product.label: Product
product.tooltip: Current state of your product or service

openness.label: Openness
openness.tooltip: Level of openness to external contributors

explore.title: Explore & Align
explore.description: We analyze readiness and motivation; clarify roles, expectations and initial rules. Goal: decide if we're ready and under what conditions we start.

define.title: Define & Adopt
define.description: We establish base rules (ownership, governance, distribution) and adopt a minimal rhythm (Scrum-lite) to operate with clarity.

test.title: Test & Learn
test.description: We introduce validation (Lean), define simple metrics and sustain rapid learning cycles.

evolve.title: Evolve & Scale
evolve.description: We review rules, metrics and practices; integrate AngoraSix Platform more deeply to scale effectively.

align-expectations.title: Align expectations and roles
align-expectations.purpose: Clarify roles, responsibilities and initial team expectations.
whenToUse: At the start of a new project

initial-rhythm.title: Establish initial rhythm
initial-rhythm.purpose: Define a basic work rhythm to start operating.
whenToUse: At the start of any project

validate-opportunity.title: Validate problem and opportunity
validate-opportunity.purpose: Confirm there's a real problem and market opportunity.

base-agreements.title: Base agreements and ownership
base-agreements.purpose: Establish fundamental ownership and governance rules for the project.

processes-tools.title: Processes and tools
processes-tools.purpose: Adopt work processes and tools to operate efficiently.

financial-structure.title: Financial structure
financial-structure.purpose: Define how project finances and distributions will be managed.

experiment-cycle.title: Experiment cycle
experiment-cycle.purpose: Implement a systematic process of experimentation and learning.

sprint-rhythm.title: Sprint rhythm
sprint-rhythm.purpose: Establish an agile work rhythm based on short sprints.

distribution-scheme.title: Distribution scheme
distribution-scheme.purpose: Implement a system to distribute value among participants.

roadmap-scalability.title: Roadmap and scalability
roadmap-scalability.purpose: Plan long-term growth and scalability of the project.

rules-review.title: Rules review
rules-review.purpose: Review and update project rules and agreements periodically.

health-metrics.title: Health metrics
health-metrics.purpose: Monitor team and project health continuously.

financial-optimization.title: Financial optimization
financial-optimization.purpose: Optimize financial management and project distributions.

q1.question: How long does the complete process take?
q1.answer: It depends on your scenario and team size. A startup might complete the basic cycle in 2-3 months, while a mature organization might take 6-12 months to implement all dimensions.

q2.question: Do I need to follow all stages?
q2.answer: No, the process is adaptive. Based on your configuration, some activities might not apply to your situation. Focus on what's relevant for your current stage and context.

q3.question: What are the AngoraSix modules?
q3.answer: Compass helps with readiness assessment, Charter manages base rules and governance, Pulse tracks metrics and team health, and Platform handles ownership tracking and distributions.

q4.question: Can I change scenarios mid-process?
q4.answer: Absolutely. As your project evolves, you can adjust the configuration to reflect your new reality. The recommendations will adapt accordingly.

q5.question: Do you provide templates and resources?
q5.answer: Yes, each activity includes templates, guides, and resources to help you implement it effectively. These are available through our documentation and advisory services.
